alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Calhoun, Clarendon and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerton, Bowman, Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee, Poplar Creek Landing, Stumphole Landing and St. Paul. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 95 and 114. Interstate 26 between mile markers 159 and 165. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
